problem: A ball of mass 0.440 kg moving east (+x direction) with a speed of 3.80 m/s collides head-on with a 0.220-kg ball at rest. If the collision is perfectly elastic, what will be the speed and direction of each ball after the collision?

correctFormulas.name: 1D elastic collision results
correctFormulas.formula: v₁f = [(m₁ − m₂)/(m₁ + m₂)] v₁ᵢ + [2m₂/(m₁ + m₂)] v₂ᵢ

correctFormulas.name: 1D elastic collision (second mass)
correctFormulas.formula: v₂f = [2m₁/(m₁ + m₂)] v₁ᵢ + [(m₂ − m₁)/(m₁ + m₂)] v₂ᵢ

steps.explanation: Plug the numbers into the second expression.
Both velocities remain in the +x (east) direction, with the lighter ball moving faster.
steps.notations: Ball 1: 1.3 m/s east; Ball 2: 5.1 m/s east
